style.name: Classic English-Style Pale Ale
style.description: Classic English pale ales are golden to copper colored and display earthy, herbal English-variety hop character. Note that "earthy, herbal English-variety hop character" is the perceived end, but may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. Medium to high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma should be evident. This medium-bodied pale ale has low to medium malt flavor and aroma. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to strong. Chill haze may be in evidence only at very cold temperatures. The absence of diacetyl is desirable, though, diacetyl (butterscotch character) is acceptable and characteristic when at very low levels.

breweries.name: Late Knights
breweries.description: At the start of 2013, Penge in SE London gained it's first and BEST brewery, yesss. Not only is the beer hand crafted, but the brewery was hand built by little beavers named Martyn, Mik, Steve and Sam; taking a derelict victorian slaughterhouse and fixing it up good and proper. This is something we're most proud of, as it's generally not the done thing! But every part that we completed was a milestone, making us even more fond of our brewery and the processes. And we are now capable of kicking out 100 casks of beer a week, and very happy to be here.

breweries.name: Cellar Dweller
breweries.description: Cellar Dweller was conceived on a warm summer evening overlooking the vineyards at the Schuchter Family home. Following dinner and enjoying our wines, we realized we were forced to turn elsewhere for the beer. We at Valley Vineyards have created this line of craft beers for our family and friends. So please … enjoy!

style.description: Classic English pale ales are golden to copper colored and display earthy, herbal English-variety hop character. Note that "earthy, herbal English-variety hop character" is the perceived end, but may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. breweries.name: Abbeydale Brewery
breweries.description:
We are proud to be a successful small business in and from Sheffield.

We were lucky enough to get in on the ground floor of the revival of craft beer, and canny enough to grow continually throughout our existence.

We have established Moonshine as a very popular local beer and all of our regular and special beers have a following somewhere - sometimes in the most unusual places!

We have one pub of our own, The Rising Sun in Nether Green, Sheffield where you can always try one (or more!) of at least six of our beers that are always on show alongside up to seven beers from other small breweries. Nearly all of these are sourced by swapping with like-minded brewers, proving that we like to share our love for all things beer related.

data.name: Directors
data.description: Originally brewed exclusively for the directors of the brewery, this amber ale is full of character with a distinctive spicy hop aroma. The perfect balance of crystal malt with crisp, fruity, nutty hops and a lasting finish.

breweries.name: Wells and Young's Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Wells and Young's Brewing Company is the epitome of all-round business excellence, demonstrating sustained growth for its beers and stockists whilst combining traditional family values with innovation and development. 

Firmly placed as the UK's largest private brewing company, it is fiercely independent, and with an enviable portfolio of some of the UK's most loved cask beers and speciality lager brands.

breweries.name: Rushing Duck Brewing Company
breweries.description: Rushing Duck brewing Co. is a small craft brewery based out of Orange County, NY. Our plan is to produce a wide variety of tasty beers. Hoppy, malty, American-styled, Belgian influenced, barrel aged, sours, you name it. First and foremost we will be brewing beer that we like to drink. We hope you do too.

data.name: Dominion Ale
data.description: This English style ale is malty with an assertive hop character. The result is a beautiful crystal clear amber color with a medium body
data.foodPairings: Pairs well with Asian & Mediterranean cuisine as well as sharp cheddar & Monterey Jack cheeses

breweries.name: Fordham & Dominion Brewing Company
breweries.description: Based on our shared values and a common philosophy of quality brewing, Fordham & Dominion joined forces in 2007 and consolidated operations in 2009. The First State is now home to the Fordham & Dominion Brewing Co., where beer lovers from near and far are able to stop by, get to know us, and enjoy our handcrafted beer and soda. Our roots run deep throughout the Mid-Atlantic region and we remain dedicated to our craft.

data.name: DORORTHY GOODBODY’S PEDAL PUSHER
data.description: A bespoke ale celebrating the ‘Land of Hops & Glory’ cycle sportive. Pale-chestnut in colour with biscuity toffee notes and a spicy hop finish.

data.name: Double Dragon
data.description:
Double Dragon has an ABV of 4.2%. It is a full drinking, premium Welsh Ale, which is malty and subtly hopped. Double Dragon has a rich colour and smooth balanced character. This deep copper red ale has a tangy red fruit flavour with nutty, toffee overtones.

Double Dragon is available in 9 gallon firkins, 11 and 6.6 gallon kegs as well as 500ml bottles and cans.

data.name: Double Swan
data.description:
The beer is a very pale ale, brewed using Pale ale malt only. The hops used are English Fuggles, Progress and Goldings, and an American hop Willamette.
 
The beer has a floral aroma, refreshing to the taste with good bitterness and a slightly sweet mouthfeel.

breweries.name: Elgood's Brewery
breweries.description:
Elgood’s Brewery is a family business established over 200 years ago and run by the Elgood family since 1878. You can find out more about our history here.
 
Today’s Chairman is Nigel Elgood, who ran the brewery as managing director from 1968 to 2002.
 
In that year he handed over the running of the business to the eldest of his three daughters Belinda, who continues as the managing director; while her two sisters Claire and Jennifer are directors. We are very proud of our family history and its association with Elgood’s Brewery.

data.name: Dubrue Pub Ale
data.description: An English style session ale with a lemon citrus aroma and a coy hop background. This beer has the chops to satisfy long time craft drinkers, but is still delicate enough to entice the non-initiated.

breweries.name: Dubrue
breweries.description:
Duluth is an old industrial city and a thriving tourist destination. A city that used to boast 3 major production breweries among its ore docks, wheat granaries, and timber barons is now home to at least 5 microbreweries and brewpubs. Maybe it’s the water – fresh, cold, and right outside our door.  
 
Dubrue is building on this rich and local brewing history with a 15 bbl system located in the heart of downtown Duluth. And we’re brewing in the established tradition: start with great ingredients – fresh water, barley, and hops – and end with a satisfying brew. Our Duluth roots, combined with west-coast training and 10 years of brewing and building recipes, help us focus on consistency in our flagship beers: an irresistibly drinkable Pub Ale, and a hoppy and inspired India Black Ale.

breweries.name: Milkhouse Brewery at Stillpoint Farm
breweries.description:
Milkhouse Brewery at Stillpoint Farm is now open.  Visit us Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. We offer handcrafted farmhouse ales made in small batches from hops and grains grown on the farm.  Check our web page and face book page for hours.

Check back in the coming months for our grand opening!

breweries.name: Raw Brewing Company
breweries.description: Raw Brewing Company was created from a passion for real ale and an idea that became reality. After several years of enjoying real ale David decided to have a go himself as a hobby to see if he could produce quality real ale. After several months it was clear that the product was good with the assistance from an army of tasters! It was time then to turn this passion and idea into reality Raw Brewing Company was born.

data.name: EKG Pale English inspired pale Ale
data.nameDisplay: EKG Pale English inspired pale Ale
data.description: We took a detour from playing with American Pale Ales to cross the pond with an English inspired Pale Ale. Instead of dry hopping, copious amounts of East Kent Golding and Northern Brewer hops were added late in the kettle for a nuanced earthy hop character. Its modest malt character is countered by a noticeable dryness.

breweries.name: El Toro Brewing Company
breweries.description: Geno and Cindy Acevedo founded El Toro Brewing Company in the summer of 1992. After much planning, research and construction business was begun in March of 1994. The brewery is a small 17-barrel (527 gallon) batch system and operates on the Acevedo's rural residential property.  Within seven months of opening El Toro Brewing Company received its first national recognition at the 1994 Great American Beer Festival (GABF). One of its flagships El Toro Oro Golden Ale won a coveted Gold Medal for English Pale Ale. At the 1996 GABF Poppy Jasper Amber Ale, the brewery's other flagship beer, won a Silver Medal for English Brown Ale. It is a mild yet robust brown ale. The 1997 GABF saw El Toro garner another Gold Medal for the American styled wheat beer named after the brewer's father-in-law, William Jones Wheat Beer.  After 16 years of planning, Geno and Cindy Acevedo of Morgan Hill finally opened a brewpub on November 25 2006. El Toro Brewpub is a two floored building with patio. Inside is the world's only Poppy Jasper Bar. Featuring over 45 feet of gorgeously inlaid and polished Poppy Jasper rock into its surface. To the back of the large mirrored bar you will find over 25 beers and handcrafted sodas on tap. We also have a gleaming copper Pub Brewing system 3 BBL (100 gallon) brewery. Live music and dancing will also be a regular nighttime happening at the brewpub consisting of mostly local bands playing cover type and original Rock, Blues, Jazz and Reggae.

data.name: Endeavor Ale
data.description:
Embark upon a voyage of discovery and aventure with this light, refreshing beer with an adventurous aftertaste.

Dedicated to the life of Whitby's Captain James Cook and the famous ship The Endeavour. Brewed using Marris Otter malt and a combination of four different hops including Hersbrucker & Saaz hops to give a delicate, fruity aftertaste.

breweries.name: Acorn Brewery of Barnsley
breweries.description:
Established in May 2003 by former chef Dave Hughes and his wife Judi, Acorn Brewery is located to the east of the Pennines in the village of Wombwell, Barnsley.

Having worked for Barnsley Brewery as Head Brewer for two years, Dave decided to go it alone, purchased a ten barrel brewplant from the Forester & Firkin brewpub in Stafford and moved it to premises in Wombwell.

 Following a lot of hard work by Dave and his assistant brewer Steve Bunting, and despite some initial set backs, the brewplant was commissioned and production of Acorn Brewery Barnsley Bitter began on 4th July 2003, using the same yeast strain as the original Barnsley Brewery, founded in the 1850's. Since then, sales have grown steadily and the range of beers has increased.

Acorn Brewery has developed a popular Yorkshire brand and is currently supplying over 300 free trade outlets and 3 national wholesalers.  

There are currently three award-winning beers permanently available, as well as regular seasonal brews.

breweries.name: Railhouse Brewery
breweries.description:
Raihouse Brewery was officially founded Dec 1, 2010, in the historic town of Aberdeen, North Carolina. Started by military veterans Brian Evitts (U.S. Navy), and Mike Ratkowski (U.S. Army). They met as managers of the same company and were drawn together by the same home brewing passion to make excellent beers. Brian has been an avid home brewer for almost 15 years, while Mike has always enjoyed the culture of breweries. They both felt there was a lack of their style of beer--beer focused on the malted barley and not so focused on the hops.

Railhouse Brewery currently offers seasonal and year-round beers, including the following: Mastiff Oatmeal Stout, KA-BAR Brown Ale, FCA IPA, Vanilla Porter, Barleywine, and Pale Ale. The brewery and pub is located at 105 East South Street, Aberdeen, NC.

data.name: English Pale Ale
data.description: A flavorful, yet refreshing session beer. Medium copper in color, medium bodied, with a toasty-caramel malt flavor. Brewed with 2-Row Malt, Caramel Malt, Victory Malt, Oat Malt, English Hops, and an English Yeast strain that gives it a slight fruitiness. Year Round Flagship. English Pale Ale contains 5% ABV.

Medium to high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma should be evident. This medium-bodied pale ale has low to medium malt flavor and aroma. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to strong. Chill haze may be in evidence only at very cold temperatures. The absence of diacetyl is desirable, though, diacetyl (butterscotch character) is acceptable and characteristic when at very low levels.

breweries.name: Kirkwood Station Brewing Company
breweries.description: Kirkwood Station Restaurant and Brewing Co. is located just a block north of the historic train station in beautiful downtown Kirkwood Missouri, a southwest suburb of St. Louis. Established in 2009, we are building a tradition of taste, quality, service and charm. With our award winning craft beer, exceptional food, and fabulous live music, the focus is on our guests and great times! Sit back with friends and enjoy the wonderful food and craft beer as you play billiards, throw darts, watch the game, or dance the night away. Whether it’s a small gathering or a party of 275 guests, Kirkwood Station wants you to enjoy the ride.

data.name: English Pale Ale
data.description: The nose is flowery, fruity, with a nice malt backbone. Sturdy in complexion, fruity notes from the yeast play with the biscuit and bread from the malt. Hops provide a pleasant bitterness without being too intrusive.

data.name: English Pale Ale
data.description: Brown's English Pale is not simply the sum of its ingredients. Rather than being simply malt or hop-forward, it offers a delicate balance of fruity yeast, bready and toffee-like malt sweetness, earthy and floral hop flavor, all rounded out by a subtle "mineral-ly" water base. As a Pale Ale, the hops play a large role, and thus it is both present in the bitterness (Fuggle hops), as well as in the flavor and aroma through dry hopping. Medium bodied and garnet in color, this beer pairs very well with fish and chips, and fruity deserts.

style.name: Classic English-Style Pale Ale

breweries.name: Brown's Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Back in 1993, Garry and Kelly Brown had a vision to turn a 150 year-old warehouse on a then-blighted River Street in Troy into a fully operational craft brewery. The building was previously owned by a local printing company and had been gutted by a massive fire and the project took three painstaking years to complete. However, the endeavor was well worth it as Brown’s Brewing Company became an instant success as the first brewery restaurant in the Capital Region.

Today, our River Street Taproom in Troy, New York is a social hub for the community and offers a menu that compliments the beer we brew on site. We brew over 25 different styles of ales and lagers throughout the year and serve over a dozen beers on tap at any one time. Our dependable ales and lagers are also available in bottles at home or on draft in select taverns and restaurants throughout the Capital Region.

style.name: Classic English-Style Pale Ale
style.description: Classic English pale ales are golden to copper colored and display earthy, herbal English-variety hop character. Note that "earthy, herbal English-variety hop character" is the perceived end, but may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. Medium to high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma should be evident. This medium-bodied pale ale has low to medium malt flavor and aroma. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to strong. Chill haze may be in evidence only at very cold temperatures. The absence of diacetyl is desirable, though, diacetyl (butterscotch character) is acceptable and characteristic when at very low levels.

breweries.name: Southampton Publick House
breweries.description: The word about the quality of our beer began to get around the metro New York region as soon as we turned on the spigots and started to serve it in our Southampton restaurant. Almost from day one, leading restaurants, pubs and taverns have requested our crafted brews for  their own patrons. Our Brewmaster, Phil Markowski  has personally directed the flow of our ales and lagers into the finest outlets. Our Mission is to offer a wide variety of specialty ales and lagers.  Our small batch brews range from classic farmhouse styles to traditional sessions beers to be enjoyed year-round.

data.name: English Pale Ale
data.description: A refreshing English Pale Ale in the style of an ESB.  Made with British malt and a classic British ale yeast, this beer has a fruity aroma with a toffee and biscuit like finish. Dry hopped with 8lbs of Fuggles.

breweries.name: Manitou Brewing Company
breweries.description: MBC offers a wide variety of beer styles brewed on location and also craft beer from our favorite breweries around the world. While we offer a few flagship brews year round, our tap selection generally varies from week to week, and of course season to season. If you don’t see your favorite style, stop by and let us know what YOU would like to see us brew…If you ask for it, we will brew it!

data.name: English Six Grain Ale
data.description: Our owner Tom's homebrew recipe brought up to the big scale. Brewed with barley, wheat, corn, oats, rye and rice, you can expect this easy-drinking English ale to have a complex malt profile and be complimented with a nice hop balance.
data.foodPairings: Beer Braised Pot Roast, Elk Burger

breweries.name: Stone Cellar Brewpub & Restaurant
breweries.description:
1989 was the year this particular brewery was established. At the time, it was Wisconsin’s third Brewpub. Since that time #1 and #2 have vanished leaving Stone Cellar Brewpub the oldest, continually running Brewpub in the state of Wisconsin. All this in a building built 151 years ago to house a brewery!

We brew in 7 barrel (217 gallon) batches on an old, yet reliable brewhouse and can produce up to 1,000 barrels per year. We also have a small bottling line which allows us to sell bottles of our beers right from our bar.

Stone Cellar beer to go!
6 packs and growlers of Stone Cellar beer can be purchased in our bar area to enjoy at home!

breweries.name: Brigadoon Brewery & Brew School
breweries.description:
Brigadoon Brewery & Brew School is a unique seasonal brewpub and teaching facility located on the grounds of the Texas Renaissance Festival in Plantersville, Texas. To our knowledge we are the only functioning brewpub located on the grounds of a renaissance festival brewing using both period specific equipment and modern equipment to brew hand crafted ale and then serving it back to the public.

What does that actually mean? Well eight weekends a year we don our garb and brew beer using equipment, ingredients, techniques and recipes that would have been available during the 1400's through the 1600's. We then give samples of ale away and sell pints to visitors that pass through our booth allowing them the opportunity to taste a piece of living history. To our knowledge we are the only renaissance style brewery or brewpub operating at a Renaissance Festival using period recipes, equipement and methods to brew ale and then serving it back to the public.

locations.name: Main Brewery

October - November 9:00 am to Dark (6:30 to 7:30 depending on the time of year.)
Features 10 house brews and multiple Texas craft brews.
Offering tours, tastings and educational classes.

data.name: English Summer Ale
data.description:
Bright citrus hops and sun dried prairie grass on the nose.  Hop bitterness moves to caramel malts mid palate and finishes with lingering mandarin orange and refreshing bitterness.

Sandi's Signature: A light and refreshing English style pale ale with satisfying complexity on the nose and palate.

breweries.name: Miner Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Located in the heart of the Black Hills, and owned and operated by the same family behind the award-winning Prairie Berry Winery, Miner Brewing Company produces craft beers that are both traditional in nature, and yet truly “South Dakota”.

With five generations of family lineage handcrafting beverages in South Dakota, and with 15 years as winemaker and owner of Prairie Berry Winery, Brewmaster Sandi Vojta is inspired by the traditional brewing styles of her family’s European heritage. By infusing regional and seasonal ingredients into the recipes handed down to her, she has skillfully adapted those traditional styles to create craft beers with a regional character, setting each distinctly apart from other microbrews.

All of our beers are produced in small, 15-barrel fermenters, allowing us to keep each batch small enough to maintain microbrew quality and a close attention to detail at all times. The results are craft beers that are approachable and distinctive, to be enjoyed by craft beer novices and enthusiasts alike.

We invite you to experience Miner Brewing for yourself, as we open our Tap Room in Hill City this fall 2013. Stop on by for a flight or a glass, hang out to enjoy our seasonal selections, and stay a while for a little South Dakota hospitality. 

Join us in the Black Hills and discover your own pint of gold.

data.name: English-Style Olde Ale
data.description: English styled Pale Ale is made with amber, and crystal malts, and maybe just a pinch of dark malt for color. If you don't know what they mean by "smooth hoppy flavor", kiss someone who has just finished a pint of my English. If you don't like it, at least you've gotten to first base.

data.name: EPA
data.description: Our medium-bodied “EPA” English Pale Ale is an easy to drink amber colored ale that begins with an earthy, nutty aroma that leads into a soft caramel sweetness and finishes crisp and clean.  Traditional British Pale Ales are amber-hued with a mild hop character and a pleasant nuttiness provided by the British Ale yeast used to brew it.  CB’s EPA English Pale Ale is no different.  We use the finest British malts and hops to produce a beer that’s as true to style as anything from across the pond.    We kept the alcohol moderate  at about 4.75% by volume so this fine ale could be enjoyed responsibly.  This great traditional ale is amazing on its own and even more amazing when paired with food.
data.foodPairings: It pairs well with New York and English cheddar cheese, BBQ, spicy food, seafood, braised meats and game.

breweries.name: Custom Brewcrafters, Inc.
breweries.description:
Custom BrewCrafters introduced to the market in 1997 an innovative micro-brewing concept in which they have partnered with dozens of local restaurant and tavern owners in offering unique signature craft-brews custom designed for each establishment.

In addition to adding this new dimension to the Western New York beer market, Custom BrewCrafters opened a tasting room and gift shop at the brewery in Honeoye Falls, where we introduce the public to the many unique custom brews as well as educate them on craft beer and microbrewing.

breweries.name: Abbeydale Brewery
breweries.description:
We are proud to be a successful small business in and from Sheffield.

We were lucky enough to get in on the ground floor of the revival of craft beer, and canny enough to grow continually throughout our existence.

We have established Moonshine as a very popular local beer and all of our regular and special beers have a following somewhere - sometimes in the most unusual places!

We have one pub of our own, The Rising Sun in Nether Green, Sheffield where you can always try one (or more!) of at least six of our beers that are always on show alongside up to seven beers from other small breweries. Nearly all of these are sourced by swapping with like-minded brewers, proving that we like to share our love for all things beer related.

breweries.name: Keltek Brewery
breweries.description: The Keltek Brewery is a multi award winning Brewery situated in Redruth, Cornwall.

data.name: Explorer E.S.B.
data.description:
A classic English Style Pale Ale, Explorer E.S.B. challenges you to go beyond the ordinary. Assertively hopped at 43 IBU’s and a respectably strong 5.8% ABV beer in the best English tradition, Explorer is nevertheless well balanced with a chewy maltiness. The deep copper colored body and creamy white head tell you that this ale has been hand crafted from only the finest ingredients. The flavor is a satisfying blend of caramel and biscuit malts, giving way to a pleasing bitterness by mid-swallow and ending with a clean, dry, crisp finish.

 The ESB style of beer holds a unique place in the English Brewing tradition and is a subtle yet demanding ale using a large quantity of premium ingredients. It is enjoyed by those who appreciate the dedication of the Brewer in creating a drink that is truly “Extra Special” in every sense of the word.

data.name: Fear of a Brett Planet
data.description:
Fear the Hops, Not the Sour.
Wild no more. Round Guys Brewing Company's Fear of a Brett Planet infuses rich  caramel characteristics of a hearty English Amber with the dominant citrus flavor of an IPA. Moderately bittered and medium in body, this Pale Ale ferments down to a whopping 1.003 FG! Clean. To the Point. Brettynomyces bruxellensis shows up and takes care of business without imparting any sour, acetic, or barnyard flavors. No Sour. No traditional Brett character. Simply fermented for sweet IPA goodness. You won't even know it's not an ale.

breweries.name: Round Guys Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Round Guys Brewing Company, located in Lansdale, PA, developed from the ghastly mind of chief Round Guy and head brewer, Scott Rudich. Looking for a quick exit out of the treacherous confines of the corporate world, Round Guys Brewing Company jumped onto the scene in late 2011, early 2012 and hasn't looked back. 

In 2013, Round Guys Brewing Company made waves by brewing up a now renowned BerlinerWeiss (Featured in Draft Magazine 10/13 and scored a 91. Featured on Brewers Network). In 2014, Round Guys Brewing Company received city wide recognition for placing a top 3 beer in the Philadelphia region's Beervitational during Philly Beer Week with Fear of a Brett Planet, a 100% Brettanomyces fermented Pale Ale. 

Other beers in its portfolio include Round Guys Brewing Company's goto Sundown Saison and the ever beloved Kiss Off IPA. 

The brewery features a full menu on site, including 1 specialty cask beer along side four seasonal, monthly, and rare offerings.

breweries.name: Dogfish Head Craft Brewery
breweries.description: Dogfish Head Craft Brewery makes off-centered ales for off-centered people.  Since 1995, Dogfish has brewed with nonstandard ingredients such as raisins, chicory, maple syrup, and grapes, changing the way people think about beer.  Dogfish believes beer can have as much flavor, complexity, diversity, food-compatibility and ageability as the world's finest wines.  To discover your favorite off-centered ale, visit www.dogfish.com

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: Classic English-Style Pale Ale
style.description: Classic English pale ales are golden to copper colored and display earthy, herbal English-variety hop character. Note that "earthy, herbal English-variety hop character" is the perceived end, but may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. Medium to high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma should be evident. This medium-bodied pale ale has low to medium malt flavor and aroma. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to strong. Chill haze may be in evidence only at very cold temperatures. The absence of diacetyl is desirable, though, diacetyl (butterscotch character) is acceptable and characteristic when at very low levels.

breweries.name: Karbach Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We like beer. A lot. 

Our background is in the beer biz. Everything from distribution and importing to German training and brewery operations. A few years ago we had an opportunity that would allow us to open up our own brewery. We jumped on it.

We’re extremely excited about this project, and we think it shows in everything we do. This is just plain fun for us. The day it starts to feel like a job is the day when lightning shall strike us dead. Cause, hey, at the end of the day we're making beer. And beer is fun.

Join us, it should be a kick ass ride with some cool stops along the way!

data.name: Gaffers
data.description: This beer is named for anyone who has done electrical work behind the scenes in television or movies! It’s a little malty, fruity, and nutty.

breweries.name: Russian River Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Russian River Brewing Company (RRBC) was originally owned by Korbel Champagne Cellars in Guerneville, California and was founded on their historic and beautiful property amidst vineyards and redwoods near the Russian River. When Korbel decided to get out of the beer business in 2003, they generously offered the brewmaster, Vinnie Cilurzo and his wife Natalie the rights to the brand. Russian River Brewing might be something completely different now if it weren't for this incredible opportunity.
On April 3, 2004, Vinnie and Natalie reopened RRBC as a brewpub in downtown Santa Rosa to great success and began self-distributing to nearby clients. In 2008, they opened a production brewery about 1 mile from their brewpub allowing them to triple production, take on more accounts locally, and distribute some beer in 4 more states.

breweries.name: Abbeydale Brewery
breweries.description:
We are proud to be a successful small business in and from Sheffield.

We were lucky enough to get in on the ground floor of the revival of craft beer, and canny enough to grow continually throughout our existence.

We have established Moonshine as a very popular local beer and all of our regular and special beers have a following somewhere - sometimes in the most unusual places!

We have one pub of our own, The Rising Sun in Nether Green, Sheffield where you can always try one (or more!) of at least six of our beers that are always on show alongside up to seven beers from other small breweries. Nearly all of these are sourced by swapping with like-minded brewers, proving that we like to share our love for all things beer related.

breweries.name: St Peters Brewery
breweries.description:
We are an artisan brewery in Inner West Sydney specialising in high quality, hand crafted beers.

The goal of St Peters Brewery is to produce draft 
and packaged beer products for the general market, within our neighbourhood, using environmentally sustainable methods, with the specific goal of high quality products with minimum environmental impact.

breweries.name: New Holland Brewing Company
breweries.description:
New Holland Brewing Company’s deep roots in the craft industry go back to 1997. Our role as an integral member of the artisan approach is something we take seriously, yet engage lightheartedly.

We believe the art of craft lives in fostering rich experiences for our customers, through creating authentic beer, spirits and food while providing great service. Recognized for our creativity and artistry, our mission to improve the lives of craft consumers everywhere is seen in our diverse, balanced collection of beer and spirits.

locations.name: Production Facility
locations.hoursOfOperation: Brewery tours are at Noon and 3pm. Tours are $10 per person and include samples of our beer as well as a take-home New Holland pint glass.

Mon-Thurs 11am-12am
Fri-Sat 11am-1am
Sun 11am-10pm

data.name: Golden XPA
data.description: This is the big brother to our famous IPA, brewed for added strength and flavour. Derived from nearly three centuries of Caledonian brewing experise, this is a hoppier and stronger version of our award-winning Deuchars IPA.
data.foodPairings: Golden XPA is an excellent drink to enjoy with salads, seafood, quiches, and lightly spiced dishes.
